definitions.definition: a mistake in something that means that it is not correct or does not work correctly

examples.text: The argument is full of fundamental flaws.
The report reveals **fatal flaws** in security at the airport.
There is still a basic flaw in your selection procedure.
Flaws have appeared in the new version of the software.
It took me a long time to find the flaw in her logic.
Engineers have detected serious design flaws.
There is always a flaw in the character of a tragic hero.
After a short time, the flaws in her character became more apparent.
The hero's fatal flaw is ambition.

definitions.definition: a fault or small break in something that makes it less attractive or valuable

examples.text: The vase is in excellent condition except for a few small flaws in its base.
Unfortunately, this plate has a slight flaw in it.

wordOrigin: Middle English: perhaps from Old Norse flaga ‘slab’. The original sense was ‘a flake of snow’, later, ‘a fragment or splinter’, hence ‘a defect or imperfection’ (late 15th cent.).
